div.l: Ne at his tale sawe I no man hym greueA3859
But hit were only oswald þᵉ Reue
By cause he was of carpenteres craft
A lytell ire in hert laft
He began to gruch ⁊and blamed hym alyte
So þee I qduod he full wel I wol þe quyte
Wᵗith þᵉ bleryng of a proud mylleres eye
Ȝif þᵗat me luste to speke of rybaudrie
But I am old me lyste not pleye for age
Gres tyme is don my fadᵉer is forage
Þis whyte top wryteth my olde ȝeres
Myn hert is also mouled as is myn heres3870
But ȝif I fare as doth an open ers
Þᵗat ilke fruyte is eủer þᵉ lengᵉer þᵉ wers
Tyll hit be roten in mollok or in stree
We olde men y drede so fare we
Tyll we ben roten we can not be rype3875
We hopen alwey whyle þᵉ world wol pype
For in oure wyll þ̉er stykeþ eủer a nayll
To haue an hore he ⁊and to haue a grene tayll
As hath a leek for þauh oure myth be gone
Oure wyll desyreth in one
For whan we may not þan wyll we speke
Ȝut in oure asken old fyr yreke
Foure gledes haue ch I shall deuyse
Avauntynge ly angᵉer ⁊and couetyse
Þis foure spls longeþ vnto elde
Oure olde ay wel ben vn welde
But ne shall not not fayle þat hit is soth
And ȝ I haue alwey a coltes toth388
